column4: I want to shutdown the PC with a normal user. I have put this line into visudo 'zeer        ALL=NOPASSWD:/sbin/shutdown -h now', but he says only root can do that or if I place sudo before, he wants the root pw.
sudo normally wants the users password.
as a cheap/dirty way to get  where any user can 'shutdown' you can set the 'suid' bit on the shutdown binary. (a very bad security practice) :)
you seem to have the options In the  sudoers file. thats not correct. :)
